catalogue_raissonne: Pauli, Hollstein 27 iii/iii (with checked sleeve on man at left); Bartsch 25 (vol. 8, p. 127)
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: lighter rendition: Christ seated on R side of round table with bread and wine; three men conversing with Christ at the same table; a man enters the scene at far L carrying a pitcher; woman at bottom embraces Christ’s ankle
inscription:
Signature

-- in graphite on verso: P27 III | B 25
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Christ at the Table of Simon the Pharisee
